business.headline: Sensex slumps 849 points, Nifty below 24,750; Tata Steel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 849.37 points to close at 80,786.54, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 255.70 points to end at 24,712.05.

Woman got tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore. Here's how she reduced it to Rs 0Seema found herself staring at a tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore after selling a piece of land in Patna. The confusion arose due to a simple error in her tax return.

Trump's 50% tariff comes into effect from tomorrow: What's at stake?The United States government has issued a draft notification confirming the step, which will be applied through a supplementary 25% duty on top of existing tariffs.

What India really needs to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047IndiaToday.in reached out to leading economists to understand what India must do over the next two decades to achieve its 'Viksit Bharat' vision. Here's what they had to say.
HDFC Bank share crash explained: Did it actually fall over 50%?HDFC Bank's shares appeared to have tanked over 50% compared to the previous close on Dalal Street in early trade.

Switching from UPS to NPS? Here's what employees must knowCentral government employees now have a one-time chance to switch from the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) to the National Pension System (NPS). But the move comes with strict rules, deadlines, and conditions.

Simplified, new tax rules and forms: What you need to knowThe Income Tax department is working on new rules and forms under the Income-tax Act, 2025, which will be notified by December-end to ensure a smoother, simpler process for taxpayers.

Once 'white gold', cotton turns into burden for India's farmersAt present, cotton cultivation area, production, and productivity are all going down. In just two years, the cotton cultivation area has fallen by 14.8 lakh hectares, while production has dropped by 42.35 lakh bales.

Sensex crashes 900 points: Why is stock market down today?The BSE Sensex showed a negative start as trading commenced today, with most stocks tanking at the opening bell. Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% a few minutes after opening for trading.

Sensex, Nifty tank nearly 1% as US tariff fears spook D-Street investorsThe Sensex fell over 500 points, while the Nifty slipped below the psychological 24,900 mark in early trade, mirroring global risk-off cues.

What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.

entertainment.headline: Mohanlal, Sathyan Anthikad are dream duo: Hridayapoorvam actor Malavika Mohanan'Petta' actor Malavika Mohanan, who will be starring opposite Malayalam superstar Mohanlal in veteran director Sathyan Anthikad's 'Hridhayapoorvam', called the actor-director duo a dream duo to work with.

Jealous SRK taunts Farah Khan for teaching better dance to her cook DilipActor Shah Rukh Khan reacted to Farah Khan's cook Dilip's dancing skills. He shared a humorous post about not being able to dance like Dilip even after 30 years.

Kamal Haasan learnt Bengali as he was in love with Aparna Sen, says daughter ShrutiActor Shruti Haasan, in a recent interaction with Sathyaraj, disclosed her father, Kamal Haasan's reason for learning Bengali. She laughed it off, saying that he did not learn Bengali due to love for work.

Simran on work in Bollywood: Still asked for test reels, paid far less than South'Tourist Family' actor Simran recently expressed discontent with her treatment in Bollywood despite having an extensive body of work and a career spanning over 30 years across various film industries in India.

Suniel Shetty scolds artiste for ghatiya mimicry on stage, video goes viralA video of Suniel Shetty losing his cool at a mimicry artist has gone viral, with the actor calling the act "ghatiya" and advising the youngster not to imitate him poorly.

Bigg Boss 19: Amaal Mallik opens up on family rift, battling depression on Day 1Singer-composer Amaal Mallik opened up about his family issues and depression on Bigg Boss 19. He highlighted the emotional struggles he had to go through at that time.

Twelve review: Park Hyung-sik's fantasy K drama is off to a thrilling startRelease Date:Tue Aug 26, 2025Twelve brings a fresh take on fantasy with zodiac angels living secretly in Seoul. The series promises thrilling action and complex characters amid a rising dark threat.

Are micro-dramas India's next big craze? Your cheat sheet on the new OTT formatMicro-dramas are transforming mobile entertainment in India with short, engaging episodes. This format offers new revenue models and production advantages, reshaping content consumption.

Taylor Swift has already shown Life of a Showgirl album to 5 people. Who are they?Pop sensation Taylor Swift has kept 'The Life of a Showgirl' firmly under wraps, with just five individuals having listened to it in its entirety so far.

Too good: Janhvi Kapoor's boyfriend Shikhar praises Sunny Sanskari posterBusinessman Shikhar Pahariya shared his enthusiasm for his actor-girlfriend Janhvi Kapoor's upcoming film 'Sunny Sankari Ki Tulsi Kumari'. He shared the film's motion poster on social media and called it "too good."

Bigg Boss 19 Episode 2: Secret room is back, Kunickaa stirs kitchen dramaThe second episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw the return of drama, kitchen war and secret room on Monday. The contestants that stole the limelight were Kunickaa Sadanand, Baseer Ali, Tanya Mittal and Amaal Malik.

Amitabh Bachchan calls his time on Kaun Banega Crorepati poetic and specialAmitabh Bachchan called his time on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' special and poetic, while reflecting on his busy shooting schedules and fan love.

Coldplay's Chris Martin turns cupid at concert, but not without safety checksColdplay's Chris Martin paused his Wembley concert for a fan's proposal, but only after hilarious "safety checks" that left the internet in splits. The viral moment is being hailed as the singer's "ultimate redemption."

BTS' V throws first pitch during baseball game, shares hug with OhtaniBTS member Kim Taehyung, aka V, made his solo debut on the MLB pitch for a baseball game with his very first ceremonial throw, and it was nothing short of adorable.

Gaurav Khanna is the only power player of Bigg Boss 19 so far'Bigg Boss 19' has just begun, but TV star Gaurav Khanna is already stealing the spotlight. From trending hashtags to his discipline, charm and fan following, here's why he is emerging as the strongest contestant on Salman Khan's reality show.

Baseer Ali on Bigg Boss 19: Game of personality, followers cannot help you winBaseer Ali, known for Roadies and Splitsvilla, entered Bigg Boss 19 recently. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he opened up about his growth in Mumbai and his ambitions in reality TV.

Armaan Malik reacts to brother Amaal joining Bigg Boss 19, calls it boarding schoolArmaan Malik admitted he wasn't in favour of his brother Amaal Malik joining 'Bigg Boss 19', joking that he should treat it like boarding school and return soon to finish pending songs.

Gurmeet Choudhary, Debina Bonnerjee bring Ganpati Bappa home with daughtersTelevision couple Gurmeet Choudhary and Debina Bonnerjee welcomed Ganpati Bappa home with their daughters Lianna and Divisha, keeping their annual tradition alive. A viral video of the family taking the idol home has won hearts.

Mika Singh mistakes Priyadarshan's retirement as death, trolled for Om shanti gaffeMika Singh confused a post about Priyadarshan's retirement with a death announcement. Fans trolled him for commenting 'Om Shanti' on the post and said that he is still alive.

general news.headline: Flood fury in Manali: Leh highway washed away, Beas in spateHeavy rainfall in Manali caused the Beas River to overflow, triggering floods, landslides, and flash floods that swept away homes, shops, and a hotel, while cutting off highways and inundating several residential areas.

Collegium split over top court pick, dissenting judge cites 'regional imbalance'The Supreme Court Collegium's decision recommending the elevation of Patna High Court Chief Justice VM Pancholi to the top court was reportedly not unanimous, with one of the five members dissenting on grounds of regional representation.

Navy commissions two advanced stealth frigates in major boost to defence capabilitiesThe event at the Eastern Naval Command marks the first time that two frontline surface combatants, built at two different Indian shipyards, have been commissioned simultaneously.

4 dead in J&K's Doda after cloudburst triggers flash floods, damages housesThe weather bureau has warned of the possibility of further cloudbursts, flash floods, and landslides in high-altitude areas in Jammu division until at least August 27.

What's wrong with Africa's map? Does it concern India too?The African Union has intensified a campaign for the use of the "right map of Africa". In the widely used Mercator map, Africa appears smaller than it is. In a bid to depict the continent's relative size accurately, African leaders are challenging the outdated colonial perspectives for fairer perceptions in education, media, and policy. Should India, which is also depicted smaller than it is, take it up?

Xi set to host Putin, PM Modi in show of solidarity amid Trump's tariff threatsAhead of the SCO summit, experts pointed out that while bloc expansion will be a key focus, the mega-event will also serve as Xi Jinping's way of showing the US a mirror of the emerging new world order.

Video: Boulders roll down hill, hit vehicles in Arunachal; people run in panicVideos from Arunachal Pradesh highway show boulders rolling down the hill, hitting vehicles as people run to save themselves in panic.

Noida dowry death: Accused husband had an affair, hit lover after wife caught themIn her complaint, the woman alleged that Vipin and his friend Tushar called her outside her village, forced her into their vehicle, and drove away. She further claimed that they physically assaulted her, verbally abused her, and snatched her phone. She also stated that Vipin and his friend threatened to kill her.

How India's desi dogs travelled 7,000 kms, gave Australia its dingoesLong before European settlers brought their animals to Australia, dogs from India had already left their mark. From desi dogs that travelled 7,000 kms, emerged the dingo, a canine species that reshaped Australia's ecology and culture.

Why Trump was forced to silently switch laws in India tariff caseIn April, US President Trump used a national emergency law from 1977 to impose tariffs against India and other countries. However, a legal challenge, which is ongoing, forced him to silently switch to a 1962 law to enforce the tariffs. Can the case against the use of the 1977 law have bearings on Trump's tariffs?

PM launches Maruti Suzuki's e Vitara in big 'Make in India, Make for World' pushAnnouncing a "new chapter" in India's Make in India journey at the launch event in Hansalpur, PM Modi said, "From today, electric vehicles made in India will be exported to 100 countries. Along with this, hybrid battery electrolyte manufacturing is also starting today."

Can't sleep without your blanket? Here's what psychology saysWhen our sleep cycle is disturbed, say by a missing blanket or because we are in an unfamiliar environment, it can feel nearly impossible to drift off.

Video: DMK Minister's athlete son snubs Annamalai from victory podiumTamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Raja's son, Suryaa Raaja Baalu, refused to let BJP leader K Annamalai garland him with a medal at the State Shooting Games, choosing instead to accept it by hand.

Trump says will allow 600,000 Chinese students into US, MAGA goes into meltdownWhile trying to keep a fragile trade truce with China, Trump risks alienating his core base with his concessions, albeit made with gritted teeth, to Beijing.

Gandhi family is my God: DK Shivakumar 'ready to apologise' over RSS anthem rowKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said he would apologise if his RSS anthem recital hurt anyone but denied political pressure, stressing his lifelong loyalty to the Gandhi family and unwavering commitment to the Congress.

MS Dhoni didn't like me, supported his favourite players: Manoj TiwaryFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary has said that despite good performances for India, he never got enough opportunities in the MS Dhoni-led side. He feels that other players got more backing and support during the same period.

Red alert for heavy rain, thunderstorm in parts of Delhi for next three hoursThe IMD has issued a red alert for Delhi-NCR as heavy rain and thunderstorms continue into Tuesday evening. Intense convection over western Delhi and adjoining Haryana could bring showers exceeding 15 mm per hour, with gusty winds, it said.

All bluster, no action: Trump unsure how to handle ChinaDonald Trump roared into office with an aggressive stance against China. The tariff battle peaked in April when the highest duty touched 145% on Chinese goods. Since then, Trump has been lenient with China. What explains the sudden change of tack by Trump?

Why the Caspian Sea is shrinking, and what makes it a global concernThe Caspian Sea is shrinking rapidly, raising alarms around the world. Climate change, which is exacerbated by uncontrolled human activities, has escalated the shrinking of the sea.

Tamil film 3BHK finds an admirer in Sachin Tendulkar. Director Sri Ganesh reactsCricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar named the Tamil film '3BHK', starring Siddharth and Sarathkumar, as one of his recent favourites. The film's director Sri Ganesh expressed his joy on X.

BJP may get new national president ahead of Bihar polls announcement: SourcesThe BJP is likely to appoint a new national president before the Bihar Assembly election announcement, sources said. A panel of names has been prepared, and consultations will resume after the Vice President election on September 9.

Who is Jatinder Singh? Oman's Punjab-born captain set for Asia Cup debutJatinder Singh will lead Oman in the upcoming Asia Cup to be held in the United Arab Emirates from September 9. Oman will begin their campaign against Pakistan on September 12.

Haris Rauf makes bold claim for India vs Pakistan clash: We'll win both matchesPakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf has made a bold claim that they will win both of their matches against India in the Asia Cup 2025. India and Paksitan are scheduled to clash on September 14 in Dubai.

Pujara's defence deserves reels like Virat Kohli's cover drives: R AshwinFormer India off-spinner R Ashwin has called for greater recognition of Cheteshwar Pujara's cricketing achievements. Pujara retired from international cricket on Sunday, bringing the curtains down on a decorated Test career.

Want India-Pakistan to resume Test cricket: Wasim AkramFormer fast bowler Wasim Akram wants India and Pakistan to resume Test cricket. India last played Pakistan in a red ball game back in 2007 when Pakistan visited India for a 3-match Test series.

Still stuck at the buzz cut: Sharapova approves Alcaraz's new hairdoMaria Sharapova praised Carlos Alcaraz's new buzz cut at the 2025 US Open, admiring its simplicity and his confidence in carrying the look. On Monday, Alcaraz defeated American Reilly Opelka.

Santner, Phillips among big names injured for New Zealand ahead of long home seasonNew Zealand players Mitchell Santner, Finn Allen, Glenn Phillips and Will O' Rourke are suffering from various injuries ahead of their long home season, where they will host Australia, England, West Indies and South Africa.

Asia Cup debutants Oman announce squad, Jatinder Singh to lead 17-member squadOman became the sixth team to announce their squad for the Asia Cup. The side announced a 17-member team, with opener Jastinder Singh leading the side.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
